description.narrative: The proposed Project Development Objective (PDO) is (i) to enhance connectivity and road safety along the Zinder - Agadez road section in Northeastern Niger through the rehabilitation of the Tanout – Tiguidit road segment and maintenance of the full Zinder - Agadez section, and (ii) to improve access to basic socio-economic infrastructure for selected communities, along the Zinder - Agadez road section.

condition.narrative: SCHEDULE 2 Section I. A 2(a) The Recipient shall, not later than two (2) months after the Effective Date, establish and thereaftermaintain, throughout the Project implementation period, with composition, mandate and resources satisfactory to the Association, asteering committee, to be chaired by a representative of the Recipient's Ministry of Equipment and to be comprised of, inter alia:(i) a representative of its Ministry of Planning; (ii) a representative of its Ministry of Transport; (iii) a representative ofits Ministry of Environment; (iv) a representative of its Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock; (v) a representative of itsMinistry of Finance; (vi) a representative of its Ministry for Women Promotion and Child Protection; and (vii) a representative ofits Ministry in charge of Security (“Project Steering Committee”).

SCHEDULE 2 Section I. A 3(a) The Recipient shall, not later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, establish and thereaftermaintain, throughout the Project implementation period, with composition, mandate and resources satisfactory to the Association, atechnical committee, to be chaired by the Recipient's Secretary General of the Ministry of Equipment and to be comprised ofdesignated technical experts representing, inter alia: (i) the general director of major civil works; (ii) the director oftransport services; (iii) the general director of the road safety agency; (iv) the general director of rural roads; (v) the generaldirector of agriculture; (vi) the director of women promotion and child protection; (vii) the general director of the nationalbureau of environmental assessment; (viii) the general director of production and animal industries; (ix) the director ofmonitoring investment; and (x) the director of budget programming (“Project Technical Committee”).

SCHEDULE 2 Section I. A 4(d) The Recipient, through the PCU, shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date: (i)recruit a senior accountant with terms of reference, qualifications and experience satisfactory to the Association; and (ii)migratethe existing accounting software for the management of the Project, with specifications acceptable to the Association.

SCHEDULE 2 Section I. A 4(e) The Recipient, through the PCU, shall, not later than five (5) months after the Effective Date,recruit and thereafter maintain, throughout the Project implementation period an external auditor, whose qualification, experienceand terms of reference shall be acceptable to the Association.

SCHEDULE 2 Section I. C 3The Recipient shall, prepare and adopt, not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, inaccordance with terms of reference acceptable to the Association, and furnish to the Association, an annex to the PIM, outliningall arrangements and procedures as shall be required for the effective implementation of the activities under Part 2 of theProject, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association (“Annex”).

SCHEDULE 2 Section I. C. 1The Recipient shall, prepare and adopt not later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, inaccordance with terms of reference acceptable to the Association, and furnish to the Association, a Project implementation manual,outlining: (a) technical, administrative, procurement, accounting, financial management matters, environmental and socialstandards, and monitoring and evaluation arrangements; (b) corruption and fraud mitigation measures; (c) detailed coordinationarrangements on cross-sectoral collaboration with ministry technical services involved; (d) a Project grievance redress mechanism;(e) a grievance redress mechanism to manage complaints related to GBV, SEA/SH and violence against children; (f) roles andresponsibilities for implementation of Parts 1 and 3 of the Project; (g) performance indicators; (h) arrangements and proceduresfor the implementation of OPRCs (related to, inter alia: responsibilities, procurement, monitoring and evaluation, fiduciary,technical and coordination, as may be necessary to ensure effective Project implementation); and (i) such other arrangements andprocedures as shall be required for the effective implementation of the activities under Parts 1 and 3 of the Project, in form andsubstance satisfactory to the Association (“Project Implementation Manual” and “PIM”).
